intro: Hamelia tubiflora, commonly known as the flame beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of the southern United States. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 meters, featuring woody stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces striking red or orange tubular flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its flowers are adapted for pollination by hummingbirds and bees, making it an important species in pollinator habitats. Hamelia tubiflora is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
